name: Treasure Trail Motel

reviews.text: Clean rooms. Staff is nice and helpful. Remodeled wing is outstanding. Pet-friendly, central location, and free golf included. What else could you want?
reviews.title: Great value, good people.

reviews.text: After five beautiful days in Kanab, Utah, I determined that this was God's gift to us to enjoy a little bit of Heaven on Earth. The Treasure Trail Motel afforded me a very reasonably priced home away from home that is centrally located in the city of Kanab to permit walking to restaurants, shops and markets. The room was very nice, clean, comfortable with all the amenities, excellent service and a quiet calm to enjoy sleep after fun filled amazing days of adventure. I had never been to Kanab before, but my choice of stay was the best decision I ever made. Day trips to Zion National Park, the Grand Canyon, Coral Pink Sand Dunes State Park, Jacob Lake, Lee's Ferry and Lake Powell provided me with more scenic beauty than any where else I have stayed. I enjoyed a four wheel expedition through the canyons and plateaus of the majestic landscape to find wonderful Indian artifacts, beautiful water falls and the opportunity to watch the Condor fly. On another day I played golf (included with the room) on a well maintained and challenging golf course, Coral Cliffs Golf Course. There is so much to see and do, five days was not enough and therefore I am planning several trips to the area I call, " A Taste of Heaven".
reviews.title: Kanab, A Taste of Heaven on Earth!

reviews.text: Recently I had the priveledge of staying at the Treasure Trail Motel in Kanab, Utah. Kanab is also home to Best Friends Animal Society/Sanctuary. In July of this year I had a special needs cat, Roxy, admitted to their care. During my recent stay I was allowed to take her for a "sleep over" which was very beneficial to both of us. I would like to thank the Treasure Trail Motel for allowing pets in their premises and want them to know that this meant more to me than I can convey in words. Thank you very much and I will be highly recommending your place of business to anyone that I know off who is travelling to Kanab and visiting Best Friends.
reviews.title: Very Accomodating

reviews.text: Based upon reviews on Tripadvisor we booked our stay at Treasure Trail while we volunteered at Best Friends. We needed a room that we could book "overnights" from Best Friends and we wanted the microwave and fridge. The rates were very reasonable for Kanab. I probably checked every motel in town and these rates were among the lowest.
reviews.title: Not fancy but clean and friendly

reviews.text: When I booked my reservation I spoke with a very nice woman who was friendly and helpful and made sure that I got the kind of room I needed.
reviews.title: Great place to stay for Best Friends volunteers

reviews.text: This motel was nice and quiet, but it was the spacious room that I was impressed with. I stayed in one of their suites that had not been upgraded, so it was still inexpensive. I don't know why some people get upset, if a room has older fixtures. As long as it is clean, and everything works - that is what is important. I actually prefer the older, two knob, bath fixtures over the newer single knob type that you usually find in "renovated" rooms.
reviews.title: Very nice motel

reviews.text: No complaints about anything here. The pool was a nice refuge on a hot day.
reviews.title: Never again.

reviews.text: We arrived late so the Hotel left our key in an envelop on the office door, which closes at 11 p.m. if it wasn't for the light of the Best Western across the street I never would have seen the place. Business signs were all off, only a dew dimly lit parking lot lights were turned on. Got to our room and it seemed fine. I wasn't expecting much, but soon realize the exterior Windows were covered with flying ants. Pretty much fought them all night, watching them crawl on the tv was fun. Then the old lady who runs the place comes over and yells at me because I had pets. When I booked the room I told the person on the phone I had pets, but apparently the $5 an hour girl who messed up is more important than a customer. I was charged an additional $10 even though the pet rooms are the same price as my original change. I was on my way to Lake Powell and will never stay in this pit again. It looks like thee are some nice places in Kanab and this place is a joke.
reviews.title: We were not disappointed!

reviews.text: We had an upper level room at the end of the building, which was really nice because we didn't get any foot traffic going past. Both rooms were newly furnished and tastefully done and contained a small fridge and microwave. There is a small pool on the premises, but it is well kept. The continental breakfast was sparse-offering some fruit (the bowl was empty when I went in) and coffee, tea and hot chocolate. Breakfast aside, the rooms were comfortable, parking was close, and we would stay again.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: Yes this place is old. A travel court with "Route 66 flavor". I stayed in an un-renovated room. It was spotless, had a flat screen tv. The management was super friendly and helpful. The motel has a number of deals with local businesses for gas and meal discounts. Why spend twice as much for a "modern" room elsewhere, when you can stay in a place with some character, that basically has the same amenities.
reviews.title: My secret hideaway

reviews.text: We stayed here in one of the renovated rooms in the back- don't be deceived by the old time look of the hotel. The new rooms are gorgeous! Before arriving we got my mom a separate room in a newer, fancier (pricier) hotel because she hesitated based on the outside look of this motel. We should have viewed a room first because our room was just as nice, if not nicer, than hers! It had a marble bathroom and two sinks- one in the bathroom and one outside of it, which was very convenient. The room was 100% clean and modern.
reviews.title: Best hotel in town- Renovated rooms are perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel's perks are great too- we used the discounts on gas and a local restaurant. Best Friends volunteers get an additional % off room rates and pets are only $5. There is a large grassy area for dogs as well.
reviews.title: Rooms were clean and staff was friendly and very helpful.

reviews.text: This is definitely the hotel we'll stay at whenever we are in Kanab!
reviews.title: Great for Best Friends Volunteers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the newly remodeled rooms in the back. It was beautiful, clean, and very spacious. The staff was very friendly and helpful. and the rates are reasonable. We really enjoyed the golf golf course.
reviews.title: We liked it so much we came back

reviews.text: I stayed in one of the newly remodeled rooms and was pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and large and the bed was very comfortable. Microwave and fridge were new, as was flat screen tv. Best of all, they allow sleepover dogs AND cats from Best Friends. My room was on the first floor. Just one downside. Every time the people in the room upstairs walked across their room my room shook.
reviews.title: Friendly, Affordable and Clean

reviews.text: What a pleasant surprise at this cute motel. Staff was pleasant, and the price was as good as it gets on a cross-country trip. Pet friendly policy was the selling point for us, and we plan to stay here on our way back home.
reviews.title: Perfect for pets

reviews.text: From the the first phone call to the waving goodbye what a great trip. The room was a great deal clean as a whistle and looked like new. Great location in the middle of Kanab, UT. Close to all the great National Parks . Great restaurants walking from motel.
reviews.title: Giant Thumbs Up

reviews.text: Nice pool and HD TV. I'm going back. I worked in the hotel business for over 30 years and this was a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Stayed here twice and I'll be back

reviews.text: If you are volunteering at Best Friends Animal Society or traveling with your animal this is the place to stay. They are very pet friendly. They have a very nice grassy area where you can take your dog out. When I volunteer at Best Friends, and bring the dogs to the motel, they love for me to bring them to the office and meet the dogs. The rooms are extremely clean and well taken care of. Several of the rooms were recently renovated and are quite nice. Each room has a microwave and refrigerator. I love the free wireless internet and onsite laundry. All in all this is a great place to stay. You can't beat the price. The rooms are clean and very nice. It's a great choice when staying in Kanab!
reviews.title: Great staff, great room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As a single woman on vacation, I felt safe staying here, and the renovated room was clean and comfortable. Although the fixtures were dated, the staff were very helpful in anticipating my needs. Morning breakfast was coffee, choice of tea, or hot chocolate, and apples and/or oranges. I definitely recommend staying here, and would do so again if I were in the area.
reviews.title: Comfortable affordable motel in great location.

description: Treasure Trail Motel, your home away from home. Our rooms are simple yet comfortable and efficient. All rooms are 100% non-smoking. Select rooms have fridge and microwave. Treasure Trail Motel is located in the heart of Kanab and is within walking distance to all restaurants, gift shops and local attractions. Best Friends Friendly with discounts and pet sleep-overs. Free WIFI, HBO, Fuel, and Golf. Discounts on select local restaurants.
